intro: Podolepis siemssenii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada lily, is a rare and striking plant native to the high elevations of the Sierra Nevada mountain range in California. It is a bulbous perennial that produces tall, slender stems with showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its alpine habitat. Podolepis siemssenii is considered endangered due to habitat loss and climate change. Its unique floral structure and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
